sentence.Network_en: Don't bawl out like that. I can hear you.
sentence.Network_cn: 别这样穷呼喝, 我听得见.

sentence.Network_en: A good bawl made her feel better.
sentence.Network_cn: 痛痛快快哭一场使她好过些了.

sentence.Network_en: A good bawl usually makes her feel better.
sentence.Network_cn: 一场号哭通常会使她好过些.

list.abs: > + 叫喊 Bawl out> 我们的降生,都带着自己嘹亮的叫喊。这是我们向这世界发出的第一次警告。这是我们是胜利着的。因为我们的探索换来了光明。> 而以后呢.

bawl at sb ., 对某人吆喝.
The sergeant bawled commands ., 军曹大声发布命令.

jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)大声训斥，把…痛骂一顿

lj.lj_ly: tales of how she bawled out employees.
lj.lj_ls: 关于她如何训斥员工的故事。

jx.jx_cn_mean: 大声训斥：高声或严厉的谴责

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English  (in the sense ('of an animal) howl, bark'): imitative; possibly related to medieval Latin baulare 'to bark' or Icelandic baula 'to low'

entry.def: If you bawl, you shout in a very loud voice, for example because you are angry or you want people to hear you.

example.ex: When I came back to the hotel Laura and Peter were shouting and bawling at each other...
example.tran: 我回到旅馆的时候，劳拉和彼得正互相叫嚷着。

example.ex: Then a voice bawled: 'Lay off! I'll kill you, you little rascal!'...
example.tran: 然后一个声音大叫道：“赶紧停下！我会杀了你的，你这个小流氓！”

entry.def: If you say that a child is bawling, you are annoyed because it is crying loudly.

example.ex: One of the toddlers was bawling, and the other had a runny nose.
example.tran: 其中一个学步的小孩在大哭，另外一个流着鼻涕。

auth_sentence.content: But while Stone can bawl with the best of them, she can do restraint too.
auth_sentence.res_content: But while Stone can bawl with the best of them, she can do restraint too.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But while Stone can bawl with the best of them, she can do restraint too.

auth_sentence.content: Cherninsky's got his pen out, and I think he's about to go for the Dungeon Master's neck, but then he starts to bawl.
auth_sentence.res_content: Cherninsky's got his pen out, and I think he's about to go for the Dungeon Master's neck, but then he starts to bawl.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Cherninsky's got his pen out, and I think he's about to go for the Dungeon Master's neck, but then he starts to bawl.

auth_sentence.content: "Every time I have to tell them no, I bawl, " said office manager Melissa Bishop.
auth_sentence.res_content: "Every time I have to tell them no, I bawl, " said office manager Melissa Bishop.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "Every time I have to tell them no, I bawl, " said office manager Melissa Bishop.

sentences.en: The baby next door often bawls.
The peddler bawled his wares in the street.
A good bawl made her feel better.
sentences.cn: 痛痛快快哭一场使她好过些了。

sentences.en: My boss bawled me out for being late.
sentences.cn: 我迟到， 给老板训斥了一顿。

sentences.en: She doesn’t give you an order. She bawls it out.
sentences.cn: 她吩咐什么事情时总是高声发号施令。

sentences.en: The children bawled out the songs.
